intro: Peucedanum benguellense, commonly known as the Benguella cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are usually finely divided and have a mild, slightly bitter scent. Peucedanum benguellense is often found in coastal and semi-arid regions, where it adapts well to harsh environmental conditions.
